Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
down-to-earth \down-to-earth\ adj. facing reality squarely; guided by practical experience and observation rather than theory. Opposite of {idealistic}, {unrealistic}, {impractical}, and {pie-in-the-sky}.
Syn: hardheaded, hard-nosed, practical, pragmatic. [WordNet 1.5]
down-to-earth adj : sensible and practical; "has a straightforward down-to-earth approach to a problem"; "her earthy common sense" [syn: {earthy}]
